w:document.mc:Ignorable: w14 w15 w16se w16cid w16 w16cex w16sdtdh w16sdtfl w16du wp14

w:r.w:t: BR-STAT-01: Order statuses: Placed → Confirmed → Preparing → Ready → Completed; plus Cancelled.
BR-STAT-02: Block invalid transitions (e.g., Ready → Preparing).
BR-CAN-02: Restaurant can reject/cancel before Ready;
BR-SLOT-01: Pickup slots generated from opening hours + interval; no past slots.
BR-SLOT-02: Optional capacity cap per slot; full slots are unavailable.
BR-AVAIL-01: Re-validate item availability at checkout submit; if any item becomes unavailable → block submit and list impacted items.
BR-PRICE-01: Total = Σ(priceSnapshot × qty); snapshot captured at order creation; later price changes do not affect historical orders.
BR-RBAC-01: Roles: Owner/Admin (full) vs Cashier/Operator (orders + limited menu availability toggle).
BR-AUD-01: All status changes must log fromStatus/toStatus/changedBy/changedAt.
BR-CONC-01: Concurrency conflict (two operators) → only one succeeds; other sees “status already updated”.
BR-SEC-01: Dashboard requires authentication; restrict customer phone visibility by role as needed.
BR-PERF-01: Order queue refresh ≤ 10 seconds (MVP acceptable).
Staff authenticate to access dashboard features based on role (orders/menu/reports).
Staff authenticate to access dashboard features based on role (orders/menu/reports).
System displays the login page (username/email, password, Login button).
System authenticates credentials, creates session, loads role/permissions.
System routes user to landing page (Cashier → Order Queue; Admin → Orders/Menu/Reports).
Actor views the dashboard landing page. The use case ends here.
of the Basic Course of Events, the actor may select “Forgot password”. The system displays password reset instructions (portfolio-level). After completion, the actor is returned to the login page.
, if the actor has multiple roles, the system prompts the actor to select a role. After the role is selected, the system routes to the corresponding landing page. The use case continues.
If the actor enters an incorrect username/password, the system displays an error message and requests the actor to re-enter credentials.
If the actor’s account is disabled/locked, the system denies access and displays the account status message.
If authentication fails due to a system error/timeout, the system displays “Try again later” and logs the error.
Staff needs to access dashboard to process orders or manage menu.
User accounts are provisioned by Owner/Admin.
Dashboard is available; user has valid credentials.
User is authenticated; session is created; user lands on role-appropriate page.
Customer browses categories/items and sees availability.
Customer opens the app and navigates to the restaurant menu.
System displays categories and items (name, price, availability).
System displays items for the selected category.
Customer continues browsing or proceeds to cart. The use case ends here
, if the selected category contains no items, the system displays an empty state (“No items”). The customer may select a different category.
If the system cannot load categories/items, it displays an error state with Retry. After retry, the system re-attempts loading.
Customer wants to browse menu to place a pickup order.
Menu categories/items are already configured by restaurant staff.
Restaurant and menu exist; customer can access the app.
Customer can view categories/items and navigate to item detail.
Customer views item details and adds available items to cart.
Customer selects an item from the menu list.
System displays item detail (name, price, availability, description/image if available).
System adds item to cart and updates cart totals/badge.
Customer continues browsing or opens cart. The use case ends here.
, if the item is unavailable, the system disables “Add to cart” and displays “Out of stock”.
If the system cannot load the item detail, it displays an error state with Retry.
Customer selects an item from the menu list.
Item availability displayed may change during peak hours.
Item detail is displayed; item may be added to cart if available.
Customer opens search from the menu page.
System displays a keyword input field.
Customer enters a keyword and submits.
Customer selects an item from results.
Customer exits search. The use case ends here.
, if the keyword is empty, the system shows a guidance message and does not run search.
If no items match the keyword, the system displays “No results”.
If search fails, the system displays an error state with Retry.
Customer wants to find items faster by keyword.
Search is a “Should” feature; minimal implementation acceptable in MVP.
Menu data is available to search.
Matching results or “No results” state is displayed.
Customer updates quantities/removes items and proceeds to checkout.
System displays cart items, quantity controls, subtotal and total.
System updates totals immediately; if quantity becomes 0, system removes the item.
Customer proceeds or exits. The use case ends here.
, the customer may remove an item instead of changing quantity. The system removes the item and recalculates totals.
If the cart is empty, the system displays an empty state and prompts the customer to browse menu.
Customer wants to review/edit cart before checkout.
Totals update immediately when quantities change.
Customer can access cart (cart may be empty or non-empty).
Cart contents and totals reflect latest customer edits; customer can proceed to checkout.
Customer selects a valid pickup time slot based on opening hours and interval (capacity optional).
System displays available pickup time slots.
System saves the selected slot and returns to checkout summary.
Customer confirms selection and continues checkout. The use case ends here.
, the customer may reopen pickup time selection and choose another slot. The system replaces the previous selection and updates checkout.
E1. Slot list cannot be loaded
If the system cannot load slots, it displays an error state with Retry.
If the selected slot is full/unavailable, the system blocks selection and displays an explanation.
If the slot is invalid, the system blocks selection and displays an explanation.
Customer proceeds to checkout and must select a pickup time.
Restaurant opening hours and slot interval are configured.
Cart is not empty; slot generation rules exist.
A valid pickup slot is selected and shown in checkout summary.
Customer places a pickup order; system creates an Order ID with status Placed.
Customer reviews checkout summary (items, total, pickup time).
System validates required inputs (cart not empty, pickup time selected, phone present).
System re-validates item availability and slot availability at submission time.
System creates Order + OrderItems (captures price snapshots) and returns Order ID; status becomes Placed.
System displays Order Confirmation and provides link to Order Tracking.
Customer views confirmation. The use case ends here.
Customer clicks “Back to Cart” instead of placing the order.
E1. Missing/invalid phone or missing required input
If the customer leaves phone missing or enters an invalid phone format, the system shows a validation message and blocks submission.
E2. Item becomes unavailable during submit
If any item becomes unavailable at submission time, the system does not create the order, highlights impacted items, and requests cart update.
E3. Pickup slot becomes unavailable/full during submit
If the selected pickup slot becomes unavailable/full at submission time, the system blocks creation and requests the customer to select another slot.
(then customer re-enters pickup selection per UC06).
If the system fails to create the order due to timeout/server error, it displays an error and prevents duplicate order creation on retry (idempotent behavior).
MVP payment mode is Pay at Counter; system supports price snapshots at order creation.
Cart not empty; pickup time selected; phone provided; system available.
Order is created with Order ID and status Placed; confirmation is displayed; order is visible to restaurant dashboard.
Customer tracks order status timeline and timestamps.
Customer opens Order Tracking for an order.
System displays current status and status definitions.
System fetches latest status and shows “Last updated”.
Customer sees status updates and exits. The use case ends here.
, the customer may view timestamps (confirmedAt/readyAt/completedAt) when available. After viewing, the use case continues.
If the system cannot refresh status, it shows last known status and an offline/stale message with Retry.
Customer wants to know when to pick up the order.
Restaurant staff update statuses via dashboard; customer may need manual refresh in MVP.
Order exists and is accessible for tracking.
Customer sees the latest known status timeline and definitions.
Customer cancels an order only when status is Placed.
Customer opens order detail while status = Placed.
System transitions order to Cancelled and records cancelledAt.
Customer exits. The use case ends here.
If the order status is Confirmed/Preparing/Ready/Completed, the system disables cancellation and explains cancellation is only allowed before confirmation.
If the status changes before the cancellation is saved, the system blocks cancellation and shows “Status already updated”.
Customer decides to cancel before restaurant confirmation.
Cancellation is allowed only while status = Placed.
Order exists; order status is Placed.
Order status becomes Cancelled; dashboard reflects cancellation; customer sees cancellation result.
Customer views a basic list of past orders and opens detail/tracking.
System displays list of orders (Order ID, pickup time, total, status).
Customer exits. The use case ends here.
If no orders exist, the system displays an empty state.
Customer wants to view past orders.
History is minimal for MVP (basic list).
Order list is displayed; customer can open an order’s detail/tracking.
Staff view orders grouped by status tabs for fast processing.
System displays orders with key fields (pickupTime, orderId, item count, customer phone).
Staff exits queue. The use case ends here.
If the staff is not authenticated, the system redirects to login.
If the queue cannot be loaded, the system displays an error state with Retry.
New orders arrive; cashier starts shift; staff need a processing view.
Queue refresh is acceptable within ≤10 seconds for MVP.
Staff is logged in and authorized.
Staff can view orders grouped by status and open order detail.
Staff view order items, notes, pickup time, timestamps, and allowed actions by status.
Staff selects an order from queue.
System displays order detail (items, qty, notes, pickup time, phone, timestamps).
System displays allowed actions based on status (Confirm/Reject/Update Status).
Staff exits detail. The use case ends here.
E1. Status updated by another operator
If another operator updates the order before the page action completes, the system shows the latest status and prompts refresh.
Staff selects an order from queue to process it.
Available actions depend on current status; audit log exists for status changes.
Staff is logged in; order exists and is accessible by role.
Staff can view full order context and proceed with confirm/reject/status update actions.
Staff confirms a new order; system records confirmedAt and audit log.
Staff opens Order Detail for status Placed.
System transitions Placed → Confirmed, records confirmedAt, logs audit trail.
System updates queue and customer tracking.
Staff exits. The use case ends here.
If the order is already Cancelled, the system blocks confirmation and shows message.
If another staff confirms first, the system shows “Status already updated” and blocks duplicate transition.
Set estimated ready time at confirmation (Future)
A new order is received in Placed status.
Only staff can confirm; confirmation should be fast for handling-time KPI.
Staff logged in; order status is Placed.
Order status becomes Confirmed; confirmedAt and audit record are stored; customer tracking reflects update.
Staff rejects a Placed order with mandatory reason; customer sees Cancelled + reason.
Staff opens Order Detail for status Placed.
System transitions Placed → Cancelled, stores cancelReason + cancelledAt, logs audit.
System updates queue and customer tracking to show Cancelled + reason.
Staff exits. The use case ends here.
If reason is empty, the system prompts for a reason and blocks submission.
If another operator changes status first, the system blocks the update and shows “Status already updated”.
Preset rejection reasons + optional free text (Optional)
Restaurant cannot fulfill the order (out of stock/overload/cannot meet pickup time).
Reason is mandatory to reduce customer confusion.
Staff logged in; order status is Placed.
Order status becomes Cancelled with cancelReason; cancelledAt and audit record stored; customer sees reason in tracking.
Update Order Status (Confirmed → Preparing → Ready → Completed)
Update Order Status (Confirmed → Preparing → Ready → Completed)
Staff updates order status through lifecycle; system blocks invalid transitions and records timestamps + audit.
Staff opens Order Detail for a Confirmed order.
System transitions Confirmed → Preparing, records timestamp, logs audit.
System transitions Preparing → Ready, records readyAt, logs audit; customer tracking shows Ready.
System transitions Ready → Completed, records completedAt, logs audit.
Staff exits. The use case ends here.
If the staff attempts an invalid transition (e.g., Ready → Preparing), the system blocks the action and shows “Invalid status transition”.
Control returns to the same step
where the action was attempted (step 2 or 4 or 6).
If another operator updates status first, the system blocks the duplicate update and shows “Status already updated”.
Lock order while being edited (implementation choice)
Kitchen Display System integration (Out of scope MVP)
Preparation progress changes; customer pickup handover occurs.
Only allowed transitions are permitted; timestamps/audit required for reporting KPIs.
Staff logged in; order is in a valid prior status for the intended transition.
Order status is updated; relevant timestamp(s) and audit log are recorded; customer tracking reflects changes.
Admin creates/edits categories and items; validates uniqueness and price rules; price snapshot protects historical totals.
System displays categories and items list.
System validates category (non-empty, unique case-insensitive) and saves.
Admin creates an item (name, price, category).
System validates required fields and price > 0 and saves item.
Admin creates an item (name, price, category).
System saves changes (applies to future orders only).
Admin exits. The use case ends here.
A1. Edit existing item instead of creating
, the admin may select an existing item and edit fields (price/description). After saving, the system returns to the item list.
If the category name already exists (case-insensitive), the system prevents saving and shows a validation message.
If price ≤ 0, the system blocks saving and shows a validation message.
Admin needs to create/update menu for accuracy.
Category names are unique (case-insensitive); item price must be > 0.
Admin logged in and authorized for menu management.
Menu is updated and reflected in customer app; historical order totals remain unchanged due to price snapshot rule.
Staff quickly toggles item availability to prevent customers from ordering out-of-stock items.
Staff opens item list with availability toggle.
Staff toggles an item to Unavailable/Available.
System saves the change and reflects it on the customer app.
Staff exits. The use case ends here.
If the system cannot save the change, it shows an error and reverts the toggle state.
Item runs out during peak hours.
Cashier/Operator is allowed to toggle availability (limited menu permission).
Item availability is updated and reflected to customer app; unavailable items cannot be ordered.
Owner views daily orders count, revenue, orders by status, and average processing time (Confirmed → Ready).
System displays date selector and “View” action.
Owner selects a date and clicks “View”.
System displays metrics (total orders, revenue, orders by status, avg processing time).
Owner exits. The use case ends here.
If there is no data for the selected date, the system displays “No data” state.
If reporting fails, the system displays an error with Retry.
Owner/Admin wants to review daily performance and KPIs.
Processing time is measured primarily as Confirmed → Ready; timestamps are captured.
Owner/Admin logged in and authorized for reporting.
Daily summary metrics are displayed for the selected date.
Admin configures pickup slot interval and optional capacity cap.
System displays pickup slot interval (and capacity if enabled).
Admin updates interval (and capacity if used) and clicks Save.
System validates and saves configuration; applies it to slot generation.
Admin exits. The use case ends here.
If interval/capacity is invalid, the system blocks saving and shows validation error.
Owner/Admin needs to adjust slot interval/capacity for operational control.
Settings are minimal for MVP; changes apply to future slot generation.
Owner/Admin logged in; settings page available.
Slot settings are saved; customer slot list follows the updated configuration.
